intro: Caesalpiniodes caspicum, commonly known as the Caspian acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its bipinnate leaves, which are divided into small, feather-like leaflets. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically clustered at the ends of branches. Its seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods that mature to a brownish color. Caesalpiniodes caspicum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
